thread.title: Kenya: 177 Schools Get Free Internet Connection
thread.title_full: Kenya: 177 Schools Get Free Internet Connection

title: Kenya: 177 Schools Get Free Internet Connection
text:
South Africa: Telecomms Department Loses 3rd DDG in Five Months 
COMMITED TO PROJECT 
Airtel Kenya CEO Adil El Youssefi was quoted as saying that the company is committed to the ambitious project, adding that access to the Internet will keep students in schools updated and knowledgeable on current issues in all fields of knowledge. 
"With our Internet for Schools project, we aim to bridge the digital divide that exists in communities and schools without access to Internet. It is for this reason that we're proud to continue providing this free connectivity to more and more schools. This is a timely action because of the changes in the education system with more students turning to the Internet for learning resources," said Mr El Youssefi. Kenya
